title: The Sims 3
notes:
It works almost flawlessly (some performance drops) - but you need to trick Steam into bypassing the launcher.

To do this, rename Sims3Launcher.exe to Sims3Launcher.exe.old and then create a Simlink to TS3.exe using: ln -s Sims3Launcher.exe TS3.exe

title: The Sims 3 (Seasons expansion)
notes: The game launches with a workaround (as with Wine). In The Sims 3/Game/Bin folder, rename Sims3Launcher.exe to Sims3Launcher.exe.old, and then create a symbolic link to TS3.exe using the command: ln -s TS3.exe Sims3Launcher.exe

title: The Sims(TM) 3
notes: Launcher won't open, even with dotnet20sp2 installed through winetricks and prefix modified to be 32 bit.  Possibly libgnutls issue. Works with vanilla wine.

title: The Sims(TM) 3
notes: Game crashes immediately after selecting play from the popup

title: The Sims(TM) 3
notes:
Yes, bypassing the launcher as suggested here before works as intended. Game "gamma" are a bit dark, but not unplayable dark, probably due to Mesa driver problems or game problem. Just need adjusting monitor brightness and you good to go.

To bypass the launcher (refined for Linux newbie):
1. Open The Sims(TM) 3 "Bin" directory in Nautilus/File Manager (default is on /home/yourusername/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/The Sims 3/Game/Bin)
2. Find Sims3Launcher.exe and rename it to SimsLauncher.exe.old
3. Open "Bin" directory in Terminal and create a symlink to TS3.exe by typing either "ln -s TS3.exe Sims3Launcher.exe" or "ln -s Sims3Launcher.exe TS3.exe"
4. You're good to go. Enjoy!
Had to do the "bypass the launcher" trick.
title: The Sims™ 3

notes: Had to bypass the launcher with the symlink trick
title: The Sims™ 3

notes: After the Tweaks Mentioned Earlier the Game runs almost Flawlessly. Sound work everything work. sure the game is in a slightly darker gamma but it doesn't disturb you after a While. Overall the Game Runs alright. The Steam in-game Layout works. (unclickable if your on the Main menu opposed to a loaded game or the world view) The Only Downside Would Be Not being able to install Some Custom Content through the Sims 3 launcher (sims3pack files) And Installing Regular mods through a .package file would also be Very difficult as the Folder that would be normally located at "my documents" either doesn't exist or very hard to find.
title: The Sims™ 3

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 400 (Braswell) x86/MMX/SSE2
title: The Sims™ 3

notes:
TO GET THE GAME RUNNING: Go to the installation folder: (/home/YOURUSERNAME/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/The Sims 3/Game/Bin/), rename Sims3Launcher.exe to Sims3Launcher.exe.old, and rename TS3.exe to Sims3Launcher.exe. No need for command line! 

(HIGHLY RECOMMENDED) FOR MODS AND CC: the folder for mods isn't in /Documents/Electronic Arts/The Sims 3, due to proton, the folder is in (/home/YOURUSERNAME/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/47890/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/Electronic Arts/The Sims 3/Mods). This is especially important when installing bug-fixing mods like NRaas ErrorTrap and Overwatch (which I highly recommend for extremely better performance). 

DARK SCREEN WORKAROUND: My workaround for the lower screen is to use dedicated shell scripts to lower or higher the brightness. Open up a text editor of your choice, type in (no quotes) "xgamma -gamma 1.75" and save it as Higher.sh FILE FORMAT. Save, and do the same again, but this time using 1 instead of 1.75. Name THAT file Normal.sh (not Higher) and save. Don't forget to give these scripts permission to run as programs by right-clicking the scripts, and enabling "Let this script run as a program." That's all! Now you've got TS3!
title: The Sims™ 3
